image_observation.soil_condition: Evenly moist with slight perlite reflection

literature_sources: Light and Temperature Effects on Sprout Yield and Nutritional Composition
The Modulation of Light Quality on Carotenoid and Tocochromanol Biosynthesis in Mung Bean Sprouts
interpretation.summary: Early dark germination (<48h) promotes elongation but limits pigment formation; controlled WL/BL exposure after Day 2 stimulates chlorophyll and carotenoid biosynthesis. Maintain warmth and humidity, light kept minimal until cotyledon cracking.

humidity.adjustment: Increase humidifier duty or shorten fan to 1 min / 30 min
humidity.note: Allow slight airflow to prevent mold

lighting.next_phase: Introduce WL ≈ 1000 lux for 2 h at Day 2, then extend

next_imaging.note: Same angle, exposure, white balance; include sensor overlay

image_observation.sprout_status: No visible cotyledon emergence (≈36–48 h, late-germination phase)
image_observation.soil_condition: Evenly distributed but slightly darkened due to surface moisture loss

lighting.status: Light program started but too low for activation

color_analysis.interpretation: Slight green hint from cotyledon swelling or perlite reflection; no chlorophyll yet

findings.interpretation: Uniform substrate tone, no mold, delayed sprout cracking due to dryness

literature_sources: Light and Temperature Effects on Sprout Yield and Nutritional Composition
Effects of Darkness and Light Spectra on Nutrients and Pigments in Sprouts
interpretation.summary: Warmth ideal, but germination delayed by low moisture and humidity. Light before radical emergence mainly increases evaporation.

irrigation.procedure: 3 × 5-s mist cycles, 5 min apart, then auto-mist every 15 min (2–3 s)

humidity.adjustment: Increase humidifier ON-time, reduce fan cycle to 1 min every 45 min
humidity.note: If leak detected, partially cover vent to retain vapor

lighting.note: Keep total DLI low; maintain 134 lux for camera only

temperature.note: Avoid direct LED heat; prefer warm mist

soil_pH_correction.method: Add dolomitic lime solution or neutralize irrigation water

imaging_protocol.measurement: Record Lux before and after irrigation
imaging_protocol.expected_observation: Visible radicle or pale hypocotyls; ExG > +0.10 by Day 3–4

summary_plan_day3.next_capture: Same time tomorrow for ΔExG and coverage tracking

image_observation.sprout_status: White–yellow radicles emerging under and at edges of soil; successful imbibition and germination transition.

color_metrics.interpretation: ΔExG > 0.08 indicates vegetation onset; early chlorophyll precursor activity.

lighting_condition.note: LED visually ON, BH1750 reads 0 lux (likely sensor saturation or capture timing)

color_based_analysis.threshold: Vegetation onset confirmed (ΔExG > 0.08 typical of emergence)
color_based_analysis.summary: Sprout emergence confirmed; light and pH now main limiting factors.

literature_sources: Light and Temperature Effects on Sprout Yield and Nutritional Composition
Modulation of Light Quality on Carotenoid and Tocochromanol Biosynthesis in Mung Bean Sprouts
interpretation.summary: With ideal soil moisture and temperature, sprouts require adequate WL/BL light and pH correction to enhance chlorophyll and carotenoid formation. Proper spectral light improves pigment density and shortens hypocotyls.

pH_adjustment.method: Adjust irrigation water to pH 6.2 ± 0.2 using NaHCO₃ (1 g/L) or dilute lime

temperature.note: Avoid LED overheating; ventilate if needed

imaging_protocol.conditions: Record under lights ON and OFF
imaging_protocol.purpose: Recalibrate lux readings; compute ΔExG & Hue trajectory

summary_plan_day4.next_capture: Day 4, same time under both light ON/OFF

image_observation.growth_stage: Cotyledons visible and upright; hypocotyls elongating, transitioning from germination to early photomorphogenesis.

color_metrics.interpretation: Significant chlorophyll accumulation; ExG > 0.18 confirms photosynthetic activity; moderate hue variation indicates mixed canopy maturity.

color_based_analysis.summary: Chlorophyll synthesis confirmed; slight unevenness likely from light or moisture variation; pH below optimal may limit micronutrient uptake.

literature_sources: Light and Temperature Effects on Sprout Yield and Nutritional Composition
Modulation of Light Quality on Carotenoid and Tocochromanol Biosynthesis in Mung Bean Sprouts
interpretation.summary: Ideal phase to expand WL + BL exposure to 2000 lux for enhanced pigment and tocopherol formation. Maintain stable temperature and correct pH to optimize photosynthesis.

lighting.sensor_calibration: If BH1750 < 100 lux under LED, apply ×20 scaling factor

moisture_humidity.method: Mist 2 s every 20 min; fan 1 min every 45 min
moisture_humidity.note: Maintain light surface sheen; avoid pooling water

pH_adjustment.method: Use NaHCO₃ (0.5–1 g/L) or dilute lime water (1 mL/L)

temperature.note: Prevent overheating from LED; allow short ventilation if RH > 90%

imaging_protocol.method: Capture twice: under WL+BL ON and OFF ambient
imaging_protocol.reference: Include white reference patch for calibration

summary_plan_day5.imaging: ON/OFF pair at same hour with white reference patch

image_observation.growth_status: Strong upright hypocotyls with open cotyledons (~5–7 cm height). Bright yellow-green cotyledons indicate active chlorophyll development. Minor photobleaching observed near LED hotspots.

color_metrics.interpretation: Rapid greening and strong pigment synthesis; true-green emerging; minor unevenness (upper leaves lighter). Matches 'vigorous vegetation' class in color-sensor model.

color_based_analysis.summary: Strong chlorophyll and carotenoid buildup; slight upper-leaf bleaching from excessive LED exposure; pH 5.0 limits Mg and Ca uptake impacting pigment stability.

literature_sources: Modulation of Light Quality on Carotenoid and Tocochromanol Biosynthesis in Mung Bean Sprouts
Light and Temperature Effects on Sprout Yield and Nutritional Composition
interpretation.summary: Photomorphogenic activity is optimal under WL + BL exposure; mild overexposure and acidity need correction for balanced pigment synthesis.

lighting.canopy_distance_cm: Raise LED 5–10 cm or use diffuser
lighting.sensor_calibration: BH1750 under-reading (~5% of expected); apply scale ×20
lighting.goal: Reduce photobleaching; maintain even canopy lighting

moisture_humidity.method: Fine-mist 2 s every 25 min; fan 1 min every 45 min
moisture_humidity.note: Ensure light airflow to prevent fungal buildup

pH_adjustment.method: Irrigate with dilute lime (1 mL/L) or NaHCO₃ (0.5 g/L)

temperature.note: Keep below 31 °C to protect chlorophyll integrity

imaging_protocol.method: Dual capture (lights ON for pigment intensity, OFF for true color)

summary_plan_day6.lighting: WL + BL mix 2500 lux × 8 h/day; raise LED distance 5–10 cm
